message: Hello?
Hello Mr. Smith.
How can I assist you
today?
Yes, I need to surrender my driving license due to a medical condition my GP advised for 6 months.
I understand, Mr. Smith. The DVLA allows you
to voluntarily surrender your license if your
doctor recommends you stop driving for 3 months or more due to a medical condition.
Can you explain your situation in more detail?
Well, I've been having some issues with my eyesight lately. My GP says I shouldn't be driving for at least 6 months until we get it sorted out.
Okay, I see. In that case, you can voluntarily
surrender your driving license to the DVLA.
They will carry out medical checks to determine if it's safe for you to drive again after the 6-month period.
Right. But how do I go about surrendering it? I'm not sure of the process.
To surrender your license for a medical reason,
you'll need to download the 'Declaration of
Voluntary Surrender' form from the DVLA website.
Have you got access to a printer or computer to do that?
No I don't actually. I'm not very good with computers and that sort of thing.
Okay, no problem. In that case, I can send
you the form in the mail if you provide me
with your full name and mailing address.
Yes, that would be better. My name is David Smith and my address is 22 Maple Road, London SW6 2XT.
Got it, Mr. David Smith at 22 Maple Road,
London SW6 2XT. I'll get that
'Declaration of Voluntary Surrender' form sent out to you right away.
Alright, thank you.
Once you receive it, you'll need to
complete the form and send it to the
DVLA along with your driving license.
Let me give you the address to send it to...
The address is: Drivers Medical Enquiries,
DVLA, Swansea, SA99 1TU.
Okay, I've got that - Drivers Medical Enquiries, DVLA, Swansea, SA99 1TU.
That's right. Once they receive your
completed form and license, the DVLA will
process your voluntary surrender and conduct medical assessments over the 6 month period.
So they'll let me know if I can get my license back after that 6 months then?
Correct, Mr. Smith. If your condition
improves and you meet their medical
requirements after the 6 month period, you can reapply to have your driving license reinstated at that time.
Hmm alright, that makes sense I suppose. It's still very inconvenient though not being able to drive for that long!
I understand your frustration, Mr. Smith.
Losing your driving privileges even
temporarily can be very disruptive. However, your doctor and the DVLA's priority is ensuring you and others are safe on the roads.
Yes, yes I know safety is important. I'll just have to make some arrangements to get around until this is sorted.
That's the right approach. Is there local
transportation services or family members
who may be able to assist you over the next 6 months while your license is surrendered?
Well my son can probably help out when he's available, and I may need to look into some other options as well. It won't be easy but I'll manage.
I'm sure with some planning it will be
manageable, even if inconvenient. Don't
hesitate to call back if any other questions come up in the meantime while you go through this process, Mr. Smith.
Alright, thank you for your help. I'll be sure to give you a ring if I need any other information.
You're very welcome. I wish you the best
with your medical treatment over the
next 6 months. Goodbye for now, Mr. Smith.
Yes, thank you. Goodbye.
